conclusion: Determine the velocity of ions after velocity selector and charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by magnetic analyzer.
Velocity selector consists of uniform electric field E and uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Electric field exerts force qE and magnetic field exerts force qvB on ion; forces must be balanced for ion to pass without deflection.
Solve for velocity v: v = E/B.
Magnetic analyzer consists of uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Radius of circular path in magnetic field: R = mv/qB.
Substitute v = E/B into radius equation: R = mE/qB^2.
Radius related to charge-to-mass ratio: R = 1/(q/m) * E/B.
Ions selected with radius of curvature between R1 and R2: R1 <= mE/qB^2 <= R2.
Solve for charge-to-mass ratio: q/m = E/(B^2 * R).
Charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected: q/m = E/(B^2 * R1) or q/m = E/(B^2 * R2).
Final answer for velocity v: v = E/B.
Final answer for charge-to-mass ratio: q/m = E/(B^2 * R1) or q/m = E/(B^2 * R2).
